description: Surrogate primary key for this log entry; unique per record.
Identifier of the user who executed the transaction.
Code indicating the nature of the cost event (e.g., receipt, adjustment, reversal); confirm allowed codes with SME.
Account number in the chart of accounts charged/credited by this transaction.
PO identifier linked to the cost event, typically the source document.
Vendor identifier associated with the linked purchase order.
Optional project/job code charged for this cost; may be blank when not project-related.
Perâ€‘unit monetary cost used for this transaction; zero may indicate no cost impact.
Category of cost (such as parts, labor, fees) stored as a code; confirm code set.
Timestamp when the system recorded this transaction in the log.
Effective date/time the cost adjustment applies, which may differ from the log timestamp.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Type of item involved (e.g., part, service); used for reporting and accounting.
Timestamp of the last user-driven modification to this record; may mirror the system modified date.
User who originally created the record.
Timestamp when the record was first created.
User who last updated the record.
Timestamp when the record was last updated.
